documents.name: The Green Grotto
documents.visualDescription: Overgrown cave mouths and mossy limestone arches packed with travelling wagons, hanging vines, lantern pools, muddy grass, damp stone, and rough fairground clutter; everything feels rural, lucky, and gritty but still storybook-bright.

documents.name: The Misty Mountains
documents.visualDescription: Pearl-white marble paths and obsidian accents around a luxury lodge and quarry: crisp geometry, velvet ropes, espresso props, polished stone, and winter-clean shapes that read rich and intimidating from an isometric view.

documents.name: Bubble Brook
documents.visualDescription: Urban canal strip with all-white fashion, iridescent plastics, neon accents, glitter signage, and glossy paving; ring-lights, beauty-tech props, and party polish make it instantly readable and hyper-social.

documents.name: Poison Pumpkin Posse Territory
documents.visualDescription: Stylised brutalist blocks and estate courtyards with high-contrast concrete patterns, black silhouettes, warning-orange accents, and UV graffiti; scooters, masks, and sharp stencils give a strong 2D read.

documents.name: Cobble Cross
documents.visualDescription: Central hub marketplace built around a spinning cobblestone plaza with candy-cane glass streetlamps and banners with simple moving illustrations; iconic figures include the Ticket Warden and the Map-Seller Twins.

documents.name: The Whisper Kiosk
documents.visualDescription: Tiny octagonal booth with a brass bell, ear-shaped sign, stacked scrolls, red string, and dangling gossip charms; designed to pop clearly as a single landmark in a crowded square.

documents.name: Lost & Fable Found
documents.visualDescription: Pawn shop of misplaced story-items: jewel-toned shelves, warm lamplight, mismatched frames, glass cases, odd single shoes, broken crowns, and jars labelled like 'found stories'.

documents.name: The Seams
documents.visualDescription: A flat grid land where each square patch is a different climate/biome, boldly colour-coded; thick ropes stitch patch edges and oversized knots sit at intersections; odd creatures and travellers appear stranded in the 'wrong' squares.

documents.name: The Woodless Woods
documents.visualDescription: A forest layout without trees: stump-like brass forms, hedge-rows of carved substitutes, gear-saplings, and pruning paths; the Orchard Keeper (one-armed automaton with pruning scythe) is the iconic silhouette.

documents.name: Candyland Carnival
documents.visualDescription: Flat fairground made of sweets and carnival props: striped tents, lollipop signposts, caramel carts, gumdrop bollards, frosting bunting; reads like a travelling carnival parked permanently on bright ground.

documents.name: Witch's Wharf
documents.visualDescription: Colourful docks with witchy craft: brooms as oars, cauldrons as barrels, crooked lanterns, spell jars, driftwood runes; tar-black wood, sea-glass water, violet highlights.

documents.name: Wishing Well Ward
documents.visualDescription: Bright courtyard town built around wells and fountains: white stone, sky-blue tiles, bucket rigs, tiled channels, coin sparkle details, and round well silhouettes visible from above.

documents.name: Painted Prairie
documents.visualDescription: Wide flat prairie in bright painted colour bands; windmills, fence lines, and patterned hay bales create strong map silhouettes; sky gradients feel illustrated rather than realistic.

documents.name: Thimblebrook Keep
documents.visualDescription: Miniature-logic keep with oversized household-object architecture: spool towers, needle gate, matchbox walls, enamel-bright trims and brass details; reads cute but fortified.

documents.name: Ink Lane
documents.visualDescription: Printing lane of bright shopfronts: giant rollers, hanging broadsheets like laundry, binding frames, animated posters on walls; high-contrast inks on parchment tones.

documents.name: Mushroom Meadows
documents.visualDescription: Flat land packed with many different bright mushrooms: oversized toadstools, ring clusters, patterned caps, spore-puff shrubs; nickname: Mushroom Madlands.

documents.name: Clattermarket
documents.visualDescription: Static inter-faction bazaar: tents made from flags, anvils beside neon signs, spiced-metal smoke; three iconic vendors (smith, glam tailor, potion-brewer) share one cashbox.

documents.name: The Receipt Tree
documents.visualDescription: A landmark tree whose leaves are receipts; pinned paper flutters like foliage with red string and brass pins; unmistakable from a distance as a paper-canopy silhouette.

documents.name: Yodel Yarns
documents.visualDescription: Stone steps carved into a hillside, each step marked with simple note symbols; the Resonance Gate is a round 'sound door' with carved wave lines; reads like a musical route landmark.

documents.name: Fairyglade
documents.visualDescription: Bright woodland glade with lantern-flowers, ribbon grasses, and tiny party lights; spring greens and peach blossoms create a friendly, magical clearing vibe.

documents.name: Fairyglade Feasting Hall
documents.visualDescription: Big timber hall in the glade; long tables visible from above; ivy trim and warm interior glow make it read as a cosy 'main hall' landmark.

documents.name: Pixie Parlor
documents.visualDescription: Cosy taproom annex with rounded door, glowing bottles, cheeky signage; jewel-bright bottles and warm amber lighting make it an instant 'bar' read.

documents.name: Whispering Woods
documents.visualDescription: Darker forest pocket with thick canopy, bold shadow pools, twisted trunks, oversized roots, and pale fungus lights; designed as a rare 'dark' aesthetic zone without going grey.

documents.name: Trollbridge Toll Bridge
documents.visualDescription: Chunky mossy stone arch bridge with troll huts built into the sides, lantern posts, and a bold toll boom; classic fairy-tale crossing silhouette.

documents.name: Rainbow Riverbank
documents.visualDescription: Cheerful riverbank with painted stones, ribbon reeds, and bright posts; colour accents read 'rainbow' without needing reflective effects.

documents.name: Muddybottom Marsh
documents.visualDescription: Comical marsh with big mud pools, bright reeds, and silly signposts; friendly-squelch vibes with bold shapes for 2D readability.

documents.name: Candlewax Palace
documents.visualDescription: Palace made of layered colourful wax with drip-tower silhouettes, giant candelabra motifs, ballroom banners; inhabited by a tacky feudal royal family who hosts elaborate balls.

documents.name: Nymph's Nook
documents.visualDescription: Small lush water-meadow nook: reed-ring pool, shell benches, vine arches, and soft pastel waters; gentle and pretty without being generic.

documents.name: Faelight Fen
documents.visualDescription: Bright fen with glowing reed clusters and floating light-orbs; boardwalk lines and glow-lilies create a strong top-down pattern.

documents.name: Willowwisp Way
documents.visualDescription: A winding path lined with willow-like silhouettes and evenly spaced wisp-lantern posts; reads as a clear route feature between regions.

documents.name: Brimstone Bank
documents.visualDescription: Scorched-but-colourful riverbank: ember-red rocks, smoky reeds, sulfur-yellow highlights; a bold 'hot river edge' landmark without needing fire simulation.

documents.name: Moonlit Market
documents.visualDescription: Night market with lantern strings, dark-blue canopies, silver accents, and tight stall rows; reads instantly as 'after-dark trading'.

documents.name: Direwood
documents.visualDescription: Danger-coded woods with spiky branch silhouettes, clawed stumps, and sharp pale-bark highlights; clear 'don't linger' vibe in a storybook style.

documents.name: Nightshade Nook
documents.visualDescription: A tight, shadowy corner packed with purple-black hedges and dark flowers with poison-green stamens; small but very distinct floral silhouette zone.

documents.name: Grimstone Gate
documents.visualDescription: Imposing stone gateway landmark with cold blue-grey stone and bright rune accents; big arch shape designed for strong map readability.

documents.name: Grimwood
documents.visualDescription: Dense, heavier 'storybook scary' forest: thicker canopy and darker massing than Direwood, with strong root shapes and fewer open clearings.

documents.name: Sobby Sadlands
documents.visualDescription: Comedic melancholy plains with droopy plants, sagging signposts, puddle-eyed stones, and 'downturned' shapes while staying colourful and readable.

documents.name: The Treacherous Trees
documents.visualDescription: Forest of obvious gotcha-shapes: hook branches, snagging roots, warning-red fungi, and trap-like silhouettes that read mischievous and risky.

documents.name: Fangbang Fields
documents.visualDescription: Open fields with cheeky vampire/were-creature cues: fang-shaped fence posts, bite-mark hay bales, and bold red/cream contrasts for instant theme read.

documents.name: The Broken Oath
documents.visualDescription: Tavern landmark with a snapped oath-scroll or broken ring as the hanging sign; warm wood, cracked gold trim, and a big obvious doorway silhouette.

documents.name: Ogre Fart Falls
documents.visualDescription: Waterfall landmark with comic ogre signage, oversized footprint rocks, and harmless green 'stink mist' puffs drifting across the spray.

documents.name: The Blue Beanstalk
documents.visualDescription: Huge cobalt-blue beanstalk landmark: thick spiral base and large mint leaves forming clear platforms; designed to read iconic even in a flat 2D map.

documents.name: Spite Spittle
documents.visualDescription: Small nasty little spot with spit-slick stones, rude graffiti, sour colours, and spiky clutter; compact and instantly 'mean' in tone.

documents.name: Little Cock o' Loch
documents.visualDescription: Small loch with a tiny island, tartan bunting, and a cheeky rooster motif on signs; cosy water-edge landmark with clear ring shoreline.

documents.name: Mike's Mucky Mansion
documents.visualDescription: Filthy showpiece mansion with muddy driveway, gaudy décor visible through big windows, gold trim gone grimy, and heaps of junk arranged like trophies.

documents.name: Dummy Slummy Dumblands
documents.visualDescription: Intentionally tacky fairytale 'estate' vibe: scuffed bright murals, patched textures, mismatched fencing, and blocky low-rise silhouettes that read like projects but still storybook-colourful.

documents.name: Radgey Road
documents.visualDescription: A named road with attitude: potholes, bold painted signposts, graffiti arrows, and loud lane markings—designed as a 'route landmark' not a biome.

documents.name: Sleepy Slaglands
documents.visualDescription: Drowsy industrial-ish flats: rounded slag mounds, slow smoke curls, puddled ground, and soft 'tired' shapes—kept colourful rather than grim.

documents.name: Peepy Tomlands
documents.visualDescription: Voyeur-comedy moorlands with peephole fences, spyglass flowers, watchtower stumps, and peeking windows cut into hedges; playful and obvious from above.

documents.name: Olaf's Opening
documents.visualDescription: A bright, named clearing 'opening' marked by a big cheerful wooden sign and a clean circular grass shape; reads as a simple iconic waypoint between regions.

documents.name: Dead Divas Disco
documents.visualDescription: Undead glamour club: sparkle floor tiles, coffin booth seating, neon stage curtains, and a skull mirrorball; instantly 'spooky nightclub' in 2D.

documents.name: Fat Friend Falls
documents.visualDescription: Friendly comedy waterfall with rounded smiling rock faces and puffy cloud-spray shapes; soft, welcoming landmark that still reads big and iconic.

documents.name: Ponsey Palace
documents.visualDescription: Obvious scam-palace: too many banners, fake gold everywhere, 'VIP' ropes, over-promising signs, and tacky pomp that reads instantly as fraudulence.

documents.name: Blue Ball Butchers
documents.visualDescription: Butcher shop landmark with bold cobalt signage and cheeky spherical motifs; red/white shop stripes, tiled counter, hanging sausage shapes—very readable storefront.

documents.name: Muggy Mines
documents.visualDescription: Open-cut mine pits (no underground): colourful ore terraces, steam vents, damp haze, puddled mineral flats, and big crane silhouettes on the rim.

documents.name: Log Lake
documents.visualDescription: Lake ringed with log cabins and floating log rafts; clear circular shoreline, timber docks, and obvious raft clusters for strong 2D readability.

documents.name: Fat Fae Fields
documents.visualDescription: Plump fae-themed fields with round fairy-ring stones, chubby-wing motifs on signposts, oversized flowers, and soft bouncy shapes across the landscape.

documents.name: Magic Madhousd
documents.visualDescription: Chaotic magical oddhouse complex: crooked doors, mismatched windows, floating furniture silhouettes, and bright clashing trims; designed to read 'mad' but playful.

documents.name: Little Thing Lodges
documents.visualDescription: Cluster of tiny lodges like dollhouses: miniature smoke puffs, bright painted doors, neat porch circles, and small-scale charm in a tight layout.

documents.name: Robbers Road
documents.visualDescription: Notorious road lined with masked signposts, robbed-looking mile markers, bandit-chic bunting, and obvious 'ambush layby' silhouettes along the edges.

documents.name: The Angerlands
documents.visualDescription: Hot-tempered landscape: cracked red earth, spiky shrubs, jagged rock faces with angry expressions carved/formed into them, and sharp hazard-like shapes.

documents.name: The Mjngerlands
documents.visualDescription: Gritty-comic grime land: mould-green stains, slumped fences, stained walls, and drippy textures—kept stylised and colourful rather than realistic or grey.

documents.name: The Stuck Uplands
documents.visualDescription: Everything looks snagged and jammed: tangled ropes, stuck carts, jammed gates, gluey-looking stones, and knot clusters that make the whole area feel 'caught'.

documents.name: WonkyWood Welcome World
documents.visualDescription: Storybook ghetto/projects/council-estate analogue: wonky low-rise blocks, bright murals, crooked fences, patched roofs, scuffed paint, and a big 'WELCOME' sign that feels ironic.

documents.name: Ya Mas Wetlands
documents.visualDescription: Cheeky wetlands with loud signage, bright boardwalk planks, splashy reeds, and exaggerated puddle shapes; designed to read playful and rude rather than spooky.
